alert.note: Alert for Adams; Cumberland; Franklin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 5:40PM EDT until March 31 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Adams County in south central Pennsylvania... Western Cumberland County in south central Pennsylvania... Franklin County in south central Pennsylvania... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 540 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chambersburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chambersburg, Carlisle, Shippensburg, Greencastle, Guilford, Plainfield, St. Thomas, Fayetteville, Mount Holly Springs, Mont Alto, Mercersburg and Scotland. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 205 to 223. Interstate 81 from mile markers 1 to 46. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
